ygData.subject: Mix URI's with SURTs in seeds.text
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, is it possible to write SURTs directly in the seeds.txt? I use the DecidingScope along with the SurtPrefixedDecideRule. I tried to mix both URIs and

Hello,

is it possible to write SURTs directly in the seeds.txt? I use the
=
DecidingScope along with the SurtPrefixedDecideRule. 
I tried to mix both U=
RIs and SURTs, the SURTs get parsed out with the
following message:

"Some =
items in seed specification were ignored. This may not indicate
any problem=
, but the ignored items are displayed here for reference:"

So is it only p=
ossible to submit SURTs over a local surt-prefix-file
(you cant submit it i=
n a jar via jmx, right)? 

I need own defined SURTs because i don't want he=
ritrix to crawl the
leading path of a given URI if the URI is pointing to a=
 concrete
document(e.g. if i submit
"http://www.example.com/example/example=
.html", i only want heritrix to
get  the document "example.html" and not cr=
awl
"http://www.example.com/example/"; otherwise, if i only submit
"http://=
www.example.com/example/", i want heritrix to crawl down from
that path). I=
t seems that this behavior is impossible to implement
using the existing sc=
opes and rules. Switching of heritrix automatic
surt building and defining =
SURTs only if i have a path seems the only
way for me to achieve the wanted=
 behavior, or is there an easier way?

cheers,

Florian Kuhlmann
